      • mapOf

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> mapOf(java.lang.Object... keysAndValues)
        Convenience method to combine a list of objects into a map Objects will be turned into strings by calling their toString() method. Sample usage:
        Map<String, String> mapOfArguments = mapOf("key1", "value1", "key2", "value2");
        would result in this: 
         {
     "key1" => "value1",
     "key2" => "value2"
 }
        Parameters:
        keysAndValues - A list of objects to be turned into strings and condensed into a map. Must be of even length and all values must be non-null.
        Returns:
        A map of the given keys and values array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the amount of parameters is not even (there is not a value for every key)
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If an element in the array was null

      • isFullName

        public static boolean isFullName(java.lang.String name)
        Tests if the given string could possibly be the full name of an Thing. In order to pass, the first character must be "t", the second character must be a digit in the range of 1-6 or 8, the third character must be an underscore, and the rest of the letters must be alphanumeric. See here for more information.
        Parameters:
        name - The String to test
        Returns:
        If the name given could be a Thing's full name

        Compares the type and subtype of two MediaTypes. Will recognize the asterisk ('*') as a wildcard.

        Prepends "/r/{subreddit}" to path if subreddit is not null
        Parameters:
        subreddit - The subreddit to use
        path - The path to use
        Returns:
        "/r/{subreddit}/{path}" if subreddit is not null, otherwise "{path}"
